author: Cortex XSOAR

automation.description: Sends a message (question) to either user (in a direct message) or to a channel. The message includes predefined reply options. The response can also close a task (might be conditional) in a playbook.
automation.name: ZoomAsk

commands.description: Disable an active user.
commands.name: iam-disable-user

commands.description: Enable a deactivated user.
commands.name: iam-enable-user

commands.description: Retrieves a single user resource.
commands.name: iam-get-user

commands.description: Retrieves a User Profile schema, which holds all of the user fields within the application. Used for outgoing-mapping through the Get Schema option.
commands.name: get-mapping-fields

integration.description: An Identity and Access Management integration template.
integration.name: Zoom_IAM

commands.description: Send a message using a chatbot app.
commands.name: send-notification

commands.description: Create a new Zoom meeting (scheduled, instant, or recurring).
commands.name: zoom-create-meeting

commands.description: Sends chat messages on Zoom to either an individual user who is in your contact list or to a channel of which you are a member.  Use the command zoom-list-users to get the user id by the user email (for to_contact). Use the command zoom-list-user-channels in order to fetch the channel ID by the channel name (for to_channel). In order to send a message, you need to provide at least a message (message text) and to_contact (contact to send) or to_channel (channel to send to), but not both of them. In order to send a style message you need to provide is-markdown=true and the message can contain a markdown format. If you are using mention markdown in a message, provide the email address in the at_contact argument.
commands.name: zoom-send-message

commands.description: Invites members that are in a user's contact list to a channel. A channel can have one or more members. The maximum number of members that can be added at once with this API is 5. Use the command zoom-list-account-public-channels in order to fetch the channel ID by the channel name.
commands.name: zoom-invite-to-channel

commands.description: Creates a channel for a user. Use the existing command zoom-list-users to get the user ID by email (only if the user has an email address as part of the user parameters).
commands.name: zoom-create-channel

commands.description: Deletes a specific Zoom channel. Use the command zoom-list-account-public-channels  in order to fetch the channel ID by the channel name.
commands.name: zoom-delete-channel

commands.description: Update an existing channel in a Zoom account. Use the command zoom-list-account-public-channels in order to fetch the channel ID by the channel name. "Need to provide at least one of the following arguments:  posting_permissions or channnel_name.".
commands.name: zoom-update-channel

commands.description: Show all the meetings of a given user. Note: only scheduled and unexpired meetings will appear.
commands.name: zoom-meeting-list

commands.description: Deletes a chat message previously sent to a contact or a channel. Use the command zoom-list-user-channels  to get the channel ID by the channel name (for to_channel). See the existing command zoom-list-users to get the user ID by email (for to_contact). In order to update messages (or a single message using messageId), you need to provide  to_contact (contact to send) or to_channel (channel to send to), but not both of them.
commands.name: zoom-delete-message

commands.description: Edits a chat message that you previously sent to either a contact or a channel in Zoom by providing the ID of the message as the value of the messageId parameter.  As a query parameter, you must provide either the contact's email address of the contact or the Channel ID of the channel where the message was sent. Use the command zoom-list-user-channels to get the channel ID by the channel name (for to_channel). Use the existing command zoom-list-users to get the user ID by email (for to_contact). In order to update messages (or a single message using messageId), you need to provide to_contact (contact to send) or to_channel (channel to send to), but not both of them.
commands.name: zoom-update-message

commands.description: Get the information of an existing Zoom meeting.
commands.name: zoom-meeting-get

commands.description: List the existing channels You can only retrieve the channel information for the authorized user. In order to get a public channel by its name (for example Admins_to_delete_4)  you need to run the command zoom-list-account-public-channels without the channel_id param and find which channel_id fits the channel name.
commands.name: zoom-list-account-public-channels

commands.description: Delete a user from Zoom.
commands.name: zoom-delete-user

commands.description: Sends a file on Zoom to either an individual user in your contact list or a channel of which you are a member. Use existing command zoom-list-users to get the user ID by the user email (for to_contact). Use the command zoom-list-user-channels in order to fetch the channel ID by the channel name (for to_channel).
commands.name: zoom-send-file

commands.description: Removes a member from a chat channel. A channel can have one or more members. Use the command zoom-list-account-public-channels in order to fetch the channel ID by the channel name. In order get the user ID by the user email - use the existing command zoom-list-users.
commands.name: zoom-remove-from-channel

commands.description: Searches chat messages or shared files between a user and an individual contact or a chat channel.
commands.name: zoom-list-messages

commands.description: List the existing users.
commands.name: zoom-list-users

commands.description: List the existing channels. In order get the user ID by user email - use the existing command zoom-list-users.  In order to get the user channel by its name, run the command zoom-list-user-channels without the channel_id param and find which channel_id fits the channel name.
commands.name: zoom-list-user-channels

commands.description: Mirrors the investigation between Zoom and the Cortex XSOAR War Room.
commands.name: mirror-investigation

commands.description: Delete a mirrored Zoom channel.
commands.name: close-channel

commands.description: Create a new user in zoom account.
commands.name: zoom-create-user

commands.description: Get the meeting record and save it as a file in the War Room.
commands.name: zoom-fetch-recording

integration.description: Use the Zoom integration to manage your Zoom users and meetings.
integration.name: Zoom

description: Use the Zoom integration manage your Zoom users and meetings
name: Zoom
readme:
Zoom
---
#### About Zoom
Zoom allows users to create and join virtual meeting rooms where they can communicate with each other using video and audio. Additional features can give participants the ability to share their screen, share files, and use text chat within the meeting group or privately with others in the meeting

#### What does this pack do?
- Create and delete Zoom users.
- Enable and disable Zoom users.
- Create meetings.
- Get info about meetings
- Get info about Zoom users.
- Get recordings of previous meetings.


#### Pack Contents
`Zoom_IAM` integration - Manage the Zoom_IAM instance within Cortex XSOAR.
`Zoom` integration - Manage the Zoom instance within Cortex XSOAR.
